casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Robert Edison ROLDAN, also known as Robert Roldan, Defendant-Appellant. No. 06-50767

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Aug. 21, 2007. Joseph H. Gay, Jr, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Western District of Texas, San Antonio, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. John David Gates, Law Offices of John D. Gates, El Paso, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Before HIGGINBOTHAM, SMITH, and CLEMENT, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Robert Edison Roldan has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Roldan has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
